content.description: Clip a bolt from the ground and pull a cruxy move to get established below the roof (some cheater stones to stand on may be helpful if you're shorter). Pull the roof on jugs and continue up 5.easy jugs with a slightly harder bulge thrown in to the shared anchor with 2hp.
content.protection: draws and slings for knob tie-offs if you want them. Jerry recommends a 2 1/2" cam but I can't recall for where
content.location: Just left of 2HP at the toe of Hawk Dome's main wall. Right where the bottom approach trail meets the wall.

climbs.name: You aren't bragging if you can't do it

content.description:
P1. 110' - Start in the dihedral, a few burly moves past a couple of bolts. Head out and pull through the roof to the easy knob pulling above. 5.11a

P2. From the anchor go straight up. Easy slab climbing up the the big tree on the ledge 5.8 80'

P3. Slightly to the  right take the bolt line straight up the slab. The first move is stupid hard (5.12c), you can pull on the first draw, the rest is much more moderate 5.10c A0. 100'
content.protection: Bolts. A couple of optional knob sling for the very top.
content.location: Starts in a obvious dihedral, just at the start of the ramp leading up

content.description: Super fun route. Crux off the slabby start/micro edges; once you gain the first decent hold after a few moves, route goes at 9+/10a the rest of the way
content.protection: First bolt clipped from the ground, second bolt close to first. More spread out bolts the rest of the way. Knob tie-offs and trad gear optional. Rap chains on the anchor.
content.location: Right of Texas Two Step 5.9; Left of Bottoms Up, Tops Down 5.9.

content.description:
Bolted line immediately to the left of Chicken Fried Daddy on the big ledge near the cave. Goes up a series of scooped. Ends on a mussy hook anchor

Fun moves, easy for the grade.
The crux comes past third bolt, route shares anchors with My Pissy Hurts.
content.protection: 5 Bolts, 7 more bolts finish on My Pissy Hurts.
content.location: Right Side of main wall by cave.

climbs.name: Myst Defying
climbs.fa: Grahm Doe, Leo Miner 3-2020 Ground Up

content.description:
Pitch 1 5.9+ 100ft Start on Crossroads. 5 bolts, nuts, cams to 1", knob slings. At 4th bolt continue straight up instead of drifting way left on Crossroads. A steeper funky bulge is protected by bolt. Knob sling then up to a thin vertical crack protected with good nuts and small cams body lengths apart. You can use the right trending crack to gain the vertical crack on left but don't continue to follow the right trending crack. After the vertical crack a final knob sling protects gaining the chain anchor at a cool golden alcove on a ledge.

Pitch 2 5.8+ 90ft 5 bolts, cams to 2", knob slings. Get a cam under the small roof above and right of the anchor. Continue up and right to bolt over bulge. Climb up easy plates to obvious left trending crack. Follow this a short ways then up knobs past 3 bolts on left. Shares final bolt with Crossroads 2nd pitch and chain anchor on big ledge just left of tree.

Preclip the first bolt to protect climber and belayer from potentially falling off large slanted belay ledge. Climb through a short two bolt overhanging section with jugs to a cruxy maneuver over bulge and lower angle face out right. Follow 8 more bolts through medium size plates and interesting climbing. The final 25 feet are easy giant knobs that can be protected with slings. Anchor is on ledge shared with You Aren't Bragging.
An enjoyable excursion across the featured main wall of Hawk Dome. Start up off the  ramp (crux) and then follow the bolt line left. Shares an anchor with "You aren't bragging...."
content.protection: Bolts. Cams 0.5-3" can be used to supplement the bolts
content.location: First bolted line off the ramp.

content.description: Great long route typical of the area. Unlike the newer routes, this ones crux is higher up and remains more sustained throughout. Definitely more thoughtful and engaging climbing. Clip the first high bolt (easy to get to) and work your way around the prow of the rock to the crux with two closely spaced bolts to protect ledge fall potential. Continue up past this as the angle eases but the holds also slowly disappear to a three bolt anchor on a ledge to the right of the start.
content.protection: Bolts, 10 or so, one knob tie off of you desire. Use extendable draws as the route wanders a bit
content.location: Left of OB/GYN, start on top of the cave-like feature. Cool spot!

content.description: Start on the right side of wide crack past bolt then left along crack to obvious bolts through steep bulges. Start can be a little dirty from draining cracks. Past 5th bolt either stay in crack on left or drift right through powerful moves and more bolts. Either variation merges after 25 feet. Giant knobs and gear protected bulges lead to a final bolt over slab. Anchor is just left of perched boulder on ledge.
content.protection: 7 bolts, many finger size then up to 2", nuts, knob slings, chain anchor

content.description: Bolted line to the left of Split personality. Crux comes at a overhanging corner system.

climbs.name: Chicken Fried Daddy
climbs.fa: Jerry, Sigrid, Lynnea Andersen. Csuri Odrey, Zac Gonslaves

content.description:
Starts on the ledge right in the cave formed by the large boulder. Start up the bolted face through a small roof.

Pitch 1 - 6 bolts. 5.10a 50'

Pitch 2 - Head left towards a ledge with a large tree. 5.9, 5 bolts

Pitch 3 - Take the line to the left of a left facing corner and exit though a roof. 5.10b. 6 bolts + offset nuts, and aliens.  100'. This is the money pitch!
Fun warmup route on Hawk Dome. No crux.
content.protection: Draws, tie-offs, and pro to 3". P1 is 110' and has 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with rap rings. P2 and 3 has less bolts and requires gear anchors.
content.location: Route start right where the lower trail to Hawk Dome comes into the main wall from the road turnout below. Route is right of unnamed 10b/c and left of Zsofie's Route 10b (shares anchor).

content.description: Five bolts through a bouldery start. Then drifts right to slightly overhanging gymnastic moves and a left facing flake. Fight back the pump to good shake holds at the top of the flake. Bigger holds and a reduced angle lead to left trending crack out right. Gain another crack up and right. Three more bolts protect a tricky 5.8/9 face section to final romp up big knobs to ledge and anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts, gear to 2.5", knob slings, chain anchor

content.description: Crux is pulling the large roof. Amazing start with average climbing above the roof. Soft for the grade.
content.protection: Bolts, some tie-offs and optional medium gear. Very well protected. Bolted anchor with rap rings.
content.location: Right of Zsofie's Route 10b, left of Gadzooks 10b.
